CdrDoc.CdrDocXml: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?> <PublishingSystem xmlns:cdr="cips.nci.nih.gov/cdr"> <SystemName>Mailers</SystemName> <SystemDescription>Reports, questionnaires, etc., mailed to PDQ board members, physicians, protocol institutions, other organizations, etc. </SystemDescription> <SystemSubset> <SubsetName>PDQ Editorial Board Members Mailing</SubsetName> <SubsetDescription>The most recent published version of each summary linked to the Board is generated for each Editorial Board Member linked to each specific summary. (A summary may be generated multiple times if it is reviewed by multiple Board members.) The summary must be formatted "similar" to the formatting on CancerNet, with references. Pages in the summary must be numbered. The name of the Board Member, the date the summary was generated, and the page number must be in the upper right hand corner. The date last modified should be printed at the bottom. Each summary must be stapled separately. Summaries must be sorted by Board Member, i.e., all summaries reviewed by a specific Board Member must be generated in order. A separator sheet with the name of the Board Member and titles of the summaries printed for them must also be generated. A standard review sheet must be generated before each summary. The review sheet may be maintained as part of the "miscellaneous" document set. A packet for a specific Board member would have following elements: (1) separator sheet with Board Member Name and Titles of the Summaries printed for them; (2) a review sheet followed by Summary Number 1; pages of the summary need to be stapled; (3) a review sheet followed by Summary Number 2. </SubsetDescription> <SubsetParameters> <SubsetParameter> <ParmName>Board</ParmName> <ParmValue /> </SubsetParameter> </SubsetParameters> <SubsetActionName>SUMMARY MAILERS</SubsetActionName> <ProcessScript>mailers/BoardSummaryMailer.py</ProcessScript> <SubsetOptions> <SubsetOption> <OptionName>Destination</OptionName> <OptionValue>d:/cdr/mailers/output/</OptionValue> </SubsetOption> </SubsetOptions> </SystemSubset> <SystemSubset> <SubsetName>Initial Protocol Abstract Verification Mailers</SubsetName> <SubsetDescription>These are mailers that contain all of the scientific, and some administrative information of the protocol (not including participants), along with a list of index terms used for retrieval. They are sent out prior to publication for every new protocol as verification of the abstracting process. A response from the recipient will not be required for publication except for Pharmaceutical trials. </SubsetDescription> <SubsetParameters> <SubsetParameter> <ParmName>CoverLetter</ParmName> <ParmValue>ProtInitAbstCoverLetter.tex</ParmValue> </SubsetParameter> </SubsetParameters> <SubsetActionName>PROTOCOL MAILERS</SubsetActionName> <ProcessScript>mailers/ProtAbstractMailer.py</ProcessScript> <SubsetOptions> <SubsetOption> <OptionName>Destination</OptionName> <OptionValue>d:/cdr/mailers/output/</OptionValue> </SubsetOption> </SubsetOptions> </SystemSubset> <SystemSubset> <SubsetName>Update Protocol Abstract Verification Mailers</SubsetName> <SubsetDescription>These are followups for mailers that contain all of the scientific, and some administrative information of the protocol (not including participants), along with a list of index terms used for retrieval. They are sent out prior to publication for every new protocol as verification of the abstracting process. A response from the recipient will not be required for publication except for Pharmaceutical trials. </SubsetDescription> <SubsetParameters> <SubsetParameter> <ParmName>CoverLetter</ParmName> <ParmValue>ProtUpdateAbstCoverLetter.tex</ParmValue> </SubsetParameter> </SubsetParameters> <SubsetActionName>PROTOCOL MAILERS</SubsetActionName> <ProcessScript>mailers/ProtAbstractMailer.py</ProcessScript> <SubsetOptions> <SubsetOption> <OptionName>Destination</OptionName> <OptionValue>d:/cdr/mailers/output/</OptionValue> </SubsetOption> </SubsetOptions> </SystemSubset> <SystemSubset> <SubsetName>Remail Protocol Abstract Verification Mailers</SubsetName> <SubsetDescription>These are remails for update protocol abstract mailers sent out at least sixty days earlier for which no reply has yet been received. </SubsetDescription> <SubsetParameters> <SubsetParameter> <ParmName>CoverLetter</ParmName> <ParmValue>ProtRemailAbstCoverLetter.tex</ParmValue> </SubsetParameter> </SubsetParameters> <SubsetActionName>PROTOCOL MAILERS</SubsetActionName> <ProcessScript>mailers/ProtAbstractMailer.py</ProcessScript> <SubsetOptions> <SubsetOption> <OptionName>Destination</OptionName> <OptionValue>d:/cdr/mailers/output/</OptionValue> </SubsetOption> </SubsetOptions> </SystemSubset> <SystemSubset> <SubsetName>Initial Protocol Status and Participant Verification Mailers </SubsetName> <SubsetDescription>Status and participant mailers are sent to the designated Protocol Update Person (PUP) for a Cooperative Group (this may change) or for an individual protocol. These are used to update the Status (i.e. Active, Approved, etc.) of the protocol, and the list of participating sites. </SubsetDescription> <SubsetActionName>PROTOCOL MAILERS</SubsetActionName>
